revised_title: The Influence of Surface Roughness and Modulus on the Adhesion of Elastic Solids
tldr: This study investigates the effect of surface roughness and modulus on the adhesion between elastic solids. The experiments were conducted using optically smooth rubber spheres and a hard flat surface of Perspex, which was roughened to varying degrees. The results show that surface roughness can significantly reduce adhesion, especially for rubbers with higher moduli. A theoretical analysis based on the contact theory of Johnson, Kendall, and Roberts is developed to explain the observed behavior.
